name: networking
content:
networking noun [U]
(meeting people)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the activity of meeting people who might be useful to know, especially in your job: Students find networking essential to getting the right job. Her networking skills were legendary in the business.
More examplesFewer examplesThe conference is designed to encourage networking and to create unique business and educational opportunities for all attendees. Every industry has some way to facilitate networking within that industry.Pessimists have poor job performance and networking skills.

networking noun [U]
(computers)
the process of connecting computers together so that they can share information: The joint project is not simply about computer networking. Wireless networking is becoming more popular in homes and small offices.
More examplesFewer examplesComputer networking allows one computer to connect to others in a limited area or beyond, and exchange information.Networking becomes more important because data has to flow back and forth instantaneously.The company provides computer networking solutions and data integration for schools and businesses.

See
network
Add to word list
Add to word list
the process of meeting and talking to a lot of people, esp. in order to get information that can help you: Students find networking essential to finding the right job.
Add to word list
Add to word list
the activity of trying to meet people who might be useful to know, especially in your job: It was a good opportunity to do some networking. The annual Country Radio Seminar is a large networking event in Nashville.
IT the process of connecting two or more computers together so that they can share information: home/office networking The website gives information about home networking and setting up a wireless home network. See also
social networking
